A

add(JComponent...) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.IGridRow
 
add(JComponent, int) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.IGridRow
Adds one component to this row and allows it to span several columns of the canonical grid.
add(JComponent...) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.INonGridRow
 
add(JComponent...) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.IRow
Adds components to this row; each component has its own "column" in the row.
addLayoutComponent(String, Component) - Method in class net.java.dev.designgridlayout.DesignGridLayout
Do not add components via the parent container's Container.add(Component) method, use directly DesignGridLayout API instead.
addMulti(JComponent...) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.IGridRow
 
addMulti(int, JComponent...) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.IGridRow
Adds components to this row; all components are "assembled" as one global component and span a given number of columns in the row.
addMulti(JComponent...) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.INonGridRow
 
addMulti(JComponent...) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.IRow
Adds components to this row; all components are "assembled" as one global component and use only one "column" in the row.

C

center() - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.IRowCreator
Creates a center-aligned row.

D

DesignGridLayout - Class in net.java.dev.designgridlayout
Swing LayoutManager that implements "Canonical Grids" as used by graphic artists to design magazines, posters, forms...
DesignGridLayout(Container) - Constructor for class net.java.dev.designgridlayout.DesignGridLayout
Builds a DesignGridLayout instance attached to a Container.

E

empty() - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.IGridRow
Adds an empty column to the current row.
empty(int) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.IGridRow
Adds one or more empty columns to the current row.
emptyRow() - Method in class net.java.dev.designgridlayout.DesignGridLayout
Adds a new empty row to the container.

F

fill() - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.INonGridRow
Sets the "extreme" component(s) of this row to fill the whole space towards the container border.

G

grid(JLabel) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.ISubGridStarter
Starts a new sub-grid in the row, starting with a label.
grid(JLabel, int) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.ISubGridStarter
Starts a new sub-grid in the row, starting with a label.
grid() - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.ISubGridStarter
Starts a new sub-grid in the row, starting with an empty label.
grid(int) - Method in interface net.java.dev.designgridlayout.ISubGridStarter

I

IGridRow - Interface in net.java.dev.designgridlayout
Any row created by DesignGridLayout.row().grid() implements this interface.
INonGridRow - Interface in net.java.dev.designgridlayout
Any row created by one of DesignGridLayout.row().left(), DesignGridLayout.row().center() or DesignGridLayout.row().right() implements this interface.
IRow - Interface in net.java.dev.designgridlayout
Any row created by DesignGridLayout implements this minimal interface.
IRowCreator - Interface in net.java.dev.designgridlayout
Interface returned by row() in order to specify the type of row to be actually added to the current layout (grid, centered, left- or right-aligned).
ISubGridStarter - Interface in net.java.dev.designgridlayout
This interface is used to start a new canonical grid row (when called from row()), or to start a new canonical sub-grid in the current grid row (when called from IGridRow).

minimumLayoutSize(Container) - Method in class net.java.dev.designgridlayout.DesignGridLayout
 

N

net.java.dev.designgridlayout - package net.java.dev.designgridlayout
DesignGridLayout is a revolutionary LayoutManager for Swing applications, based on "canonical grids", well-known in publishing.

P

preferredLayoutSize(Container) - Method in class net.java.dev.designgridlayout.DesignGridLayout
 

R

removeLayoutComponent(Component) - Method in class net.java.dev.designgridlayout.DesignGridLayout
Do not remove components via the parent container's Container.remove(Component) method; removing components from a DesignGridLayout-managed container is not supported.
